5#ifndef V8_HEAP_BASE_STACK_H_
6#define V8_HEAP_BASE_STACK_H_
7
8#include <map>
9#include <vector>
10
11#include "src/base/macros.h"
12#include "src/base/platform/platform.h"
13
14namespace heap::base {
15
16class StackVisitor {
17 public:
18 virtual ~StackVisitor() = default;
19 virtual void VisitPointer(const void* address) = 0;
20};
21
22#if defined(__has_feature)
23#if __has_feature(safe_stack)
24#define V8_USE_SAFE_STACK 1
25#endif // __has_feature(safe_stack)
26#endif // defined(__has_feature)
27
28// Abstraction over the stack. Supports handling of:
29// - native stack;
30// - ASAN/MSAN;
31// - SafeStack: https://releases.llvm.org/10.0.0/tools/clang/docs/SafeStack.html
32//
33// Stacks grow down, so throughout this class "start" refers the highest
34// address of the stack, and top/marker the lowest.
35//
36// TODO(chromium:1056170): Consider adding a component that keeps track
37// of relevant GC stack regions where interesting pointers can be found.
38class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Stack final {
39 public:
40 // Sets the start of the stack to the current stack start.
41 void SetStackStart() {
42 current_segment_.start = v8::base::Stack::GetStackStart();
43#ifdef V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
44 current_segment_.asan_fake_stack = __asan_get_current_fake_stack();
45#endif // V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
46#ifdef V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
47 current_segment_.unsafe_stack_start = __builtin___get_unsafe_stack_top();
48#endif // V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
49 }
50
51 // Returns true if |slot| is part of the stack and false otherwise.
52 // It is a static method, ignoring the set stack start and marker, but it
53 // considers the ASAN stack and SafeStack.
54 static bool IsOnStack(const void* slot);
55
56 void IteratePointers(StackVisitor* visitor) const {
57 IteratePointersUntilMarker(visitor);
58 IterateBackgroundStacks(visitor);
59 }
60
61 // Word-aligned iteration of the stack, starting at the `stack_marker_`
62 // and going to the stack start. Slot values are passed on to `visitor`.
63 void IteratePointersUntilMarker(StackVisitor* visitor) const;
64
65 void AddStackSegment(const void* start, const void* top);
66 void ClearStackSegments();
67
68 // Iterate just the background stacks, if any.
69 void IterateBackgroundStacks(StackVisitor* visitor) const;
70
71 // Push callee-saved registers to the stack, set the stack marker to the
72 // current stack top and invoke the callback.
73 template <typename Callback>
74 V8_INLINE void SetMarkerAndCallback(Callback callback) {
75 TrampolineCallbackHelper(static_cast<void*>(&callback),
76 &SetMarkerAndCallbackImpl<Callback>);
77 }
78
79 template <typename Callback>
80 V8_INLINE void SetMarkerIfNeededAndCallback(Callback callback) {
81 if (current_segment_.top == nullptr) {
82 TrampolineCallbackHelper(static_cast<void*>(&callback),
83 &SetMarkerAndCallbackImpl<Callback>);
84 } else {
85 DCHECK(IsOnCurrentStack(current_segment_.top));
86 callback();
87 }
88 }
89
90 using ThreadId = int;
91 template <typename Callback>
92 V8_INLINE void SetMarkerForBackgroundThreadAndCallback(ThreadId thread,
93 Callback callback) {
94 std::pair<ThreadId, Callback*> info{thread, &callback};
95 TrampolineCallbackHelper(
96 static_cast<void*>(&info),
97 &SetMarkerForBackgroundThreadAndCallbackImpl<Callback>);
98 }
99
100 using IterateStackCallback = void (*)(Stack*, void*, const void*);
101
102 // This method combines SetMarkerAndCallback with IteratePointers.
103 // Callee-saved registers are pushed to the stack and then a word-aligned
104 // iteration of the stack is performed. Slot values are passed on to
105 // `visitor`. To be used for testing.
106 void IteratePointersForTesting(StackVisitor* visitor);
107
108 bool IsMarkerSet() const { return current_segment_.top != nullptr; }
109
110 // This method is only safe to use in a safepoint, as it does not take the
111 // mutex for background_stacks_.
112 bool HasBackgroundStacks() const { return !background_stacks_.empty(); }
113
114 // Stack segments that may contain pointers and should be scanned.
115 struct Segment {
116 // The start and top of the stack. It must be sp <= top <= start.
117 // The top pointer is generally a marker that signals the end of the
118 // interesting stack region in which on-heap pointers can be found.
119 const void* start = nullptr;
120 const void* top = nullptr;
121
122#ifdef V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
123 // The start of ASAN's fake stack.
124 const void* asan_fake_stack = nullptr;
125#endif // V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
126
127#ifdef V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
128 // Start and top for the unsafe stack that is used in clang with
129 // -fsanitizer=safe-stack.
130 // It must be unsafe_sp <= unsafe_stack_top <= unsafe_stack_start.
131 // Notice that the terms "start" and "top" have here a different meaning in
132 // the terminology used in this feature's documentation.
133 const void* unsafe_stack_start = nullptr;
134 const void* unsafe_stack_top = nullptr;
135#endif // V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
136
137 Segment() = default;
138 Segment(const void* stack_start, const void* stack_top)
139 : start(stack_start), top(stack_top) {
140#ifdef V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
141 asan_fake_stack = __asan_get_current_fake_stack();
142#endif // V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
143#ifdef V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
144 unsafe_stack_start = __builtin___get_unsafe_stack_top();
145 unsafe_stack_top = __builtin___get_unsafe_stack_ptr();
146#endif // V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
147 }
148 };
149
150 private:
151#ifdef DEBUG
152 static bool IsOnCurrentStack(const void* ptr);
153#endif
154
155 V8_NOINLINE void TrampolineCallbackHelper(void* argument,
156 IterateStackCallback callback);
157
158 template <typename Callback>
159 static void SetMarkerAndCallbackImpl(Stack* stack, void* argument,
160 const void* stack_end) {
161 DCHECK_NULL(stack->current_segment_.top);
162 stack->current_segment_.top = stack_end;
163#ifdef V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
164 stack->current_segment_.unsafe_stack_top =
165 __builtin___get_unsafe_stack_ptr();
166#endif // V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
167 Callback* callback = static_cast<Callback*>(argument);
168 (*callback)();
169 stack->current_segment_.top = nullptr;
170#ifdef V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
171 stack->current_segment_.unsafe_stack_top = nullptr;
172#endif // V8_USE_SAFE_STACK
173 }
174
175 template <typename Callback>
176 static void SetMarkerForBackgroundThreadAndCallbackImpl(
177 Stack* stack, void* argument, const void* stack_end) {
178 DCHECK(IsOnCurrentStack(stack_end));
179 auto [thread, callback] =
180 *static_cast<std::pair<ThreadId, Callback*>*>(argument);
181 auto& background_stacks = stack->background_stacks_;
182 {
183 v8::base::MutexGuard guard(&stack->lock_);
184 DCHECK_EQ(background_stacks.end(), background_stacks.find(thread));
185 // This implicitly uses the current values (if applicable) for:
186 // - asan_fake_start
187 // - unsafe stack start
188 // - unsafe stack top
189 background_stacks.emplace(
190 thread, Segment(v8::base::Stack::GetStackStart(), stack_end));
191 }
192 (*callback)();
193 {
194 v8::base::MutexGuard guard(&stack->lock_);
195 background_stacks.erase(thread);
196 }
197 }
198
199 Segment current_segment_;
200
201 // TODO(v8:13493): If inactive stacks are not used anymore, clean this up.
202 std::vector<Segment> inactive_stacks_;
203
204 mutable v8::base::Mutex lock_;
205 std::map<ThreadId, const Segment> background_stacks_;
206};
207
208} // namespace heap::base
209
210#endif // V8_HEAP_BASE_STACK_H_
